doc.after: Mathematical beauty describes the notion that some mathematicians may derive aesthetic pleasure from their work and from mathematics in general They express this pleasure by describing mathematics or at least some aspect of mathematics as beautiful Mathematicians describe mathematics as an art form or at a minimum as a creative activity Comparisons are often made with music and poetry
